author: Special Correspondent
text:
A voters’ awareness campaign highlighting the importance of exercising their franchise during the forthcoming Assembly election was held in Sedapatti and Usilampatti under Usilampatti Assembly segment on Wednesday.

Usilampatti Revenue Divisional Officer and Returning Officer for Usilampatti Assembly segment M. Balasubramaniam led the campaign. A rally was taken out from Sedapatti panchayat union office.

The rally went through the main roads of Sedapatti, and over 300 people participated in it.

The campaign was organised in association with Puduvazhvu Thittam, in which Sedapatti Tahsildar Sivakumar participated.

“All those who had attained the age of 18 years were asked to enrol themselves in the voter list. Enrolment can be done till April 10,” the RDO said. The voters were asked to exercise their voting right without any inducement.

Similar awareness campaign was held in Kurinji Nagar, a tribal colony, in Usilampatti.
title: Voter awareness campaign held
